metadata.title: CVE-2023-21877 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.31 and prior. Easilyexploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with networkaccess via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successfulattacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause ahang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server as wellas unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Serveraccessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 5.5 (Integrity and Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:H).

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
